verbs.description: extemporize (third-person singular simple present extemporizes, present participle extemporizing, simple past and past participle extemporized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To perform or speak without prior planning or thought; to act in an impromptu manner; to improvise.
examples: "Do you mean you have been extemporizing all this time?"

entries.meaning: (transitive) To adapt, improvise, or devise action or speech in an impromptu or spontaneous manner.
examples: The wine runs into pitchers, washing-basins, shards, chamber- vessels, and other extemporized receptacles.
